item.title: Add command to server error
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

I have never programmed 377+ debob in my life and I know the answer.

What is your IQ? Didn’t they teach you too compare in school?

Compare this:

if (command.equals("ilikeparty")) { addItem(1050, 1); }

(Which is the command for 317’s…)

Too this:

if (cmd[0].equals("givejad") && p.username.equalsIgnoreCase("drowning")) { String person = playerCommand.substring((playerCommand.indexOf(" ") + 1)); Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)]; if (p2 != null) { p2.disconnected[0] = false; p2.KillJad = 1; p.frames.sendMessage(p2, "You've been given the ability to wear a fire cape!"); p2.updateReq = true; p2.appearanceUpdateReq = true; } }

(Command for 508+)

Still can’t see it?

if (command.equals("ilikeparty")) {

To

if (cmd[0].equals("ilikeparty")) {

so basically change

if (command.equals("ilikeparty")) { addItem(1050, 1); }

To

if (cmd[0].equals("ilikeparty")) { Engine.playerItems.addItem(p, 1050, 1); }

Wow, this isn’t even java programming common sense, but this is real world common sense. Seriously, what grade are you in?

And why would you add a 317 command onto a 508? 508’s are packaged and there are different varibles, new classes that handle things that are usually in client.java etc.

Not trying to be a flamer but next time try and compare your code… GEEZ Lack of common sense these days…

Read full topic
